abstract: Federal prosecutors file civil complaint against J Felix Strevel, former official in Gov George E Pataki's administration, and his daughter, Nicole Strevell-Childrose; filing asserts money used by Strevel to pay for daughter's wedding and to settle tax debt on property she owned was restitution he owed state in connection with 2007 fraud conviction.
lead_paragraph: J. Felix Strevell owed New York State money after admitting to fraud, but in a civil complaint, federal prosecutors accused him of spending it on his daughter’s farm wedding instead.

headline.main: The Wedding Was Quirky. Now the Government Is Submitting Its Bill.
headline.print_headline: Ex-Official Spent Money Owed to State, U.S. Says

snippet: J. Felix Strevell owed New York State money after admitting to fraud, but in a civil complaint, federal prosecutors accused him of spending it on his daughter’s farm wedding instead.
